question:
Consider the following statements about the project “India: Financing Energy Efficiency at MSME Project (FEEMP)”:
  1. It is part of the Global Environmental Facility (GEF) Programmatic Framework for Energy Efficiency in India.
  2. Bureau of Energy Efficiency (BEE) and Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) are the two executive agencies for the project in India.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is correct</u>. The project “Financing of Energy Efficiency at MSMEs” is a part of the Global Environmental Facility (GEF) Programmatic Framework for Energy Efficiency in India. Its major objective is to increase demand for energy efficiency investments in target micro, small and medium enterprise clusters and to build their capacity to access commercial finance. <u>Second statement is correct</u>. The GEF implementation agency for this project is the World Bank, and the two executing agencies for the same in India are Bureau of Energy Efficiency (BEE), Ministry of Power, Govt. of India and the Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI). The Development Objective of the project was to increase demand for energy efficiency investments in select micro, small and medium enterprise clusters and to build their capacity to access commercial.
